name: places/ChIJdXDc1b9ZwokRN1Qyd4JK2xM
formattedAddress: 151 W 19th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 151 W 19th St, New York, NY 10011, USA

editorialSummary.text: Local racer-owned bike shop offering sales, apparel & accessories as well as rentals & repairs.

originalText.text: Wonderful experience purchasing a bike with Chris who was insightful and courteous throughout the process.  My bike was delivered and assembled very quickly.  Highly recommend & big fan of Echelon Cycles!

text.text: Wonderful experience purchasing a bike with Chris who was insightful and courteous throughout the process.  My bike was delivered and assembled very quickly.  Highly recommend & big fan of Echelon Cycles!

originalText.text:
Fantastic experience from this shop! Had multiple points of customer service contact with them throughout the week and they were super helpful at every stage.

I couldn’t find any shops that were carrying hard shell travel cases. I called echelon and they were super helpful with locating what they had in stock, and also asking if I’d it to be set aside for me to come for it another day.

Then I came into shop a few days later, super helpful with getting me the case and letting me check it out. Helped figure out if it was what I needed and if it would fit my bike. I believed I was helped by a new employee named Adam, I may be wrong, it was his first day. They trained him excellently though, because he was super knowledgeable about everything in stock and answering any additional questions I had about other parts I was looking for. Chatted with a few other employees casually and they also were super knowledgeable about all things bike, but also just extremely friendly. Really had that community bike shop feel.

Lastly spoke with Curtis, one of the managers, about item pricing and he was super reasonable and respectful as well.

Overall I had such an excellent experience with this shop, I left a happy customer with the hard case I was looking for and a few other items. Their customer service is excellent and their bike knowledge is extensive. Other customers also seemed extremely well attended and had all their questions answered. I definitely recommend this shop!

originalText.text:
I would give this place zero stars if i could, but unfortunately that's not an option.  we purchased 2 bikes from Wing and per their instructions shipped it to Echelon cycles for assembly.  the bikes were received by the shop in early August per Fedex tracking.  however, when we called the shop, they told us only one bike was received.  so we called wing, who insisted that the bikes were shipped together.  call after call to the shop over the next 3 weeks to ask them to please look into it seems to have fallen into a black hole.  until finally one person from the shop let it slip that both bikes were received but they had sold one and chose not to tell us.  they blamed everything on Wing and never took any responsibility for selling a bike that WAS NOT THEIRS TO SELL!  so, finally, we received both bikes purchased on labor day weekend.  we voiced our displeasure of having waited for so long, and no one in the shop accepted any fault, insisting that we are NOT their customers, and they had NO OBLIGATIONS to us.  but magnanimously,  to show us a gesture of good faith, instead of just "hey, we're sorry we sold your first bike by mistake and made you wait a month for assembly" - we were told it wasn't their fault, but they will generously give us 25% off if we buy anything in the shop that day only.  *insert eyeroll*

fast forward to 2 months later, and having ridden the bike, we find out one of them is experiencing an issue with the throttle (which they installed) and throwing an error.  so, figuring since they put it together they might be able to help out with what the issue was.  again, browbeating it to us that this was "not their problem" as we were not their customer, and therefore they had zero obligation to help us.  the only way, was for us to purchase a part from Wing, wait for them to ship it, and then they will put us on the schedule to install.  but troubleshooting was not part of their job.  Incidentally, it was error 21 - which according to the Wing website, is "current abnormality".  a search on google says to check the motor cable.  this is possibly a safety issue, and they wouldn't help.  let that sink in for a bit.

here i thought as a bike shop, they could help.  so i guess if you were spending money to buy the bike at full price from their shop, they'll consider to help you.  but if you didn't get it there, don't bother as they have told us, they have no obligations to help us with a bike that was not purchased from them.

there are plenty of bike shops around, do yourself a favor, find someone else to give your hard earned dollars to.

originalText.text: LBS of choice! Chris got me the right sized bike to counter some issues I was having, and Martin’s super helpful. I go in from time to time for things like replacing pedals or general maintenance- and they’re always helpful. If you’re in Chelsea - they’re the best.

text.text: LBS of choice! Chris got me the right sized bike to counter some issues I was having, and Martin’s super helpful. I go in from time to time for things like replacing pedals or general maintenance- and they’re always helpful. If you’re in Chelsea - they’re the best.

originalText.text: Love Echelon! An excellent LBS - great inventory, great people, great service. Always stop by Echelon for my bike related needs. Highly recommend!

text.text: Love Echelon! An excellent LBS - great inventory, great people, great service. Always stop by Echelon for my bike related needs. Highly recommend!
